etymology.description: semantic: 艹 (“grass; plant”) + phonetic: 采.
etymology.interpretation: The grass/plant radical signals a meaning related to vegetation and edible greens. 采 supplies the sound for cài and also hints at the idea of picking or gathering plants.

examples.chinese: 我去市场买菜(我去市場買菜)。
examples.english: I’m going to the market to buy vegetables.

examples.chinese: 这道菜很辣(這道菜很辣)。
我喜欢川菜(我喜歡川菜)。
